meanings.definition: The wrongful performance of a lawful act.
meanings.sent1: The misfeasance of the employee led to a lawsuit.
meanings.sent2: The court found evidence of misfeasance in the company's actions.
meanings.sent3: It was clear misfeasance when the student copied the answers during the exam.
meanings.sent4: Her misfeasance in following the rules was like a red flag to the authorities.
meanings.sent5: The misfeasance of the chef resulted in a burnt dish.

meanings.sent1: The misfeasance of the politician caused public outrage.
meanings.sent2: The investigation uncovered financial misfeasance within the organization.
meanings.sent3: The misfeasance of the cat stealing treats was both naughty and amusing.
meanings.sent4: His misfeasance in handling the situation was a ticking time bomb.
meanings.sent5: The misfeasance of the driver running a red light was a dangerous risk.
